name: Secure Access
author: Bobby Walters

sections.description: Provides additional security for your site by requiring users to log in before gaining access to content.
sections.installation:
1. Upload entire secure-access directory to /wp-content/plugins/ directory.
  2. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu in WordPress.
sections.faq:
Installation Instructions

  1. Upload entire secure-access directory to /wp-content/plugins/ directory.
  2. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu in WordPress.

There isn’t a settings menu?

As of right now there aren’t any options to configure. The plugin enables security by being activated. Simply deactivating the plugin will turn off the need to log in before seeing content.

Feeds are secured as well.
sections.changelog:
1.0.1

2015-08-30

  • NEW: Using classes plugin boilerplate.
  • FIX: Cleaned up PHPCS WordPress standard sniffs.

1.0.0

Initial release.
